review_text: If I could give them less I would.  Won't deposit endorsed checks without the person there. So don't expect any ease in your banking. Not worth having an account since you can't do the things you need to do.
The best bank!!!!! Have been a member for 20 plus years! I won't change unless they do!
owner_reply: Thanks, Lisa! We're so happy we've been able to provide you with the great banking relationship we strive to give all of our customers. We look forward to working with you for many years to come.

review_text:
I've worked here for about 4 years during college.  The manager Kim Murphy is in my opinion the best community bank manager out there, or at least within CT. There are 7 offices of NWCB in Litchfield county, and we are under the umbrella of CMHC Connecticut Mutual Holding Company with 2 other community banks - Litchfield Bancorp and Collinsville Savings Society.  

Honestly, a 100% better experience than any commercial or competitor bank, we offer generally competitive and sometimes lower rates, less fees, one-on-one NO-FEE customer service with happy customers.  A much easier and hassle free way of managing personal, and business banking.  

The only pitfall is that we have local ATM's, and restricted locations! Great if you're settled down in the area, but we do accommodate to travel and have dedicated customers throughout the country.

This bank location has really poor customer service, stay away I certainly did.

I called on 6.23.17 and from the initial representative to the banker who did not even introduce himself or great me with a simple hello but instead he stated he would need to take a message and pass it on to another department. When I asked if I should call at a different time or another number he replied no he would just need to have someone call back,? I instead hung up on him.

I stopped at Bankwell bank this morning on my way up north and my experience was amazing. First of all I walked in and the man behind the counter was so energetic and so pleasant, I've never had a banking experience quite like that. He introduced me to another gentleman in the office and was very very patient and kind. He just seemed like he was happy about life and it put me a really good mood! I live about 20 minutes south from this particular branch but I will go out of my way to come here instead of going somewhere closer because of how friendly they were. If you want your day brightens a little bit go to this bank!
Awesome staff very helpful. Took care of all my needs. Explained everything very thoroughly and would recommend very highly

answer your phone and be accurate when you say your approve thousand dollar transactions!  get a grip or tell your employees they need better training! :/ best of luck you really seem to need the help if it's this hard for you
Great service. Need something ask for Linda old school personal banking at its very best. Full service rarely a wait

Worst customer service. The agent I was assigned to help with our mortgage was very unprofessional. I called him on July 4th for making an offer on a house. I had to called him two more times that day and every time he answered in a rude way since he had a family gathering. With last call he yell d at me that I am using him and wasting his time and that he doesn't want to hear from me again. Family gathering and holidays are important but if someone takes a job that involves answering to customers on a holiday they should expect that. I was never treated that badly as a customer in any other bank.

NEVER get your mortgage from these people.  The most unprofessional group of workers I've ever encountered.  STAY far away, I am in the middle of refinancing just so I can get away from these people.   Steve the loan officer is just the most rude condescending humans I've ever encountered.  their system is SO OUT OF DATE its unreal.

I've moved most of my accounts out already ever since they changed from a savings and loan to investment citing they were going broke and the first thing they do is building another branch in town.  This bank no longer reviews its client base.  I requested an increase to pay a bill.  I have more than enough in my business account to cover nor had I bounced a check written from my account.  But, because a customer bounced a check causing my deposit to bounce 2x, the bank refused.  So, this bank is unfriendly towards small businesses as most investment banks are.  It's all about their bottom line and to hell with how long you have done business with them and how well your credit is. I recommend you find another savings and loan or credit union bank as I am doing.

Everyone there is very nice and very helpful. But as far as internet bank and the phone apps, they are atleast 10 years behind everyone else. No other bank (including local banks) take 2-3 days and hours of work just to set up external bank to bank transfer, as well as no other bank offers mobile deposits but require you to get approval to do mobile deposits. These issues is what banks were doing in the beginning, now with all the stream line digital products there should be no reason for such delays.

Good friendly service.  It's nice to use a bank that is local and where you are more than just a number.  We've used Newtown Savings Bank for our savings account,  checking account and mortgage.  Think global.   Act local.

One of the most dysfunctional organizations I have ever had to deal with. I call because I have an issue with my account and I can't hear the CSR because if the laughing and giggling there, sound like they are in a bar during happy hour.  The only reason I deal with them is because it's the closest bank to me but now time to change. 

My advise is to don't get involved with this bank!
Having a problem with this bank on automatic renewal of a CD for my 88 year old mother in assisted living.    I am giving them a week to try and work it out.   Stay tuned.
This bank is the best bank I've ever experienced the pleasure of doing business with.  They are professional, yet friendly and always very efficient.  Thank you for being "My Bank".
I had a wonderful experience opening an account at Simsbury Bank. The staff was knowledgeable and made the process quick and easy to understand. I'm glad I decided to bank locally.

I have been going to the bank on Rte1 in Stonington for 20 years cashing my paycheck, today I go there and you cant talk to real people. I had to talk to someone who speaks so low you can't even hear them. Then to cash a check you have to put it in the machine and let then look at it first (it's their check) but when you ask a question about it the rep (Rafey) talks so low you can't hear him. I don't feel comfortable dealing with someone you can't hear.
Is Chelsea Groton Bank really eliminating talking to tellers face to face? If so don't put a machine next to a busy road so the cars driving by are louder than the rep with an attitude. When I called the main number to ask where there is an actual bank with people the little girl Kaylee (voice sounded like a little girl trying to act cutesy) said water street in mystic. I'm not going to downtown Mystic full of tourists this time of year to cash a check.
Guess I never use that bank again. Just another bank cutting cost's and customer service at the same time.
owner_reply:
Thank you for your feedback.  Our Mystic Auto branch is equipped with “live tellers” onsite; they can be found on the inside lane closest to the building.  The two outside lanes are drive up VBMs (Virtual banking ATMs) which provide our customers with the ability to bank 24/7, customers can also speak with a banker through video technology up to 7 pm at night which is very convenient.

We will reach out to our digital banking team to see if there’s a way to turn up the volume so that our customers can hear the conversation better. 

We're sorry that your experience using our drive-up virtual banking ATMs was not to your satisfaction, we take all feedback seriously and use it as an opportunity to improve.

review_text: Has to be one of the worst banks in the area, made a photo deposit in the bank at 250 pm on a Thursday now I I have till 4 pm for the banking day to end of course the deposit was rejected but did not receive email till 430 pm after banking hours so ok I resubmit the deposit again but now it's a Friday at 930 am when it was approved Now I have to wait from Thursday and Friday and Saturday and Sunday and Monday and Tuesday before the funds are available my issue is if a place like Walmart can cash a check immediately and withdraw funds why can't this bank do so, I been a customer for at least 3 years it's not like it's a new account this bank has treated me unfair for years I would close my account but am disabled and it's close to my house, so the bottom line want a better bank go somewhere else one thing the employee like the tellers are nice it's not there fault it's the banks main office that are incompetent and nasty
owner_reply: Hi Howard, customer service is very important to us, so we’re sorry you had a bad experience. Your feedback helps us get better.  Please reach out to Bill Mundell, FVP, Digital Services Manager at 860.448.4214 so we can learn more about the situation.

review_text:
I've been banking with Chelsea Groton for over 10 years now and today I had the worst customer experience ever. I have had mr overdraft protection since I opened my checking account. There have been times where I needed it since I live on my own, pay Bill's, eat, put oil in the tank to stay warm, gas in my car so I can get to my job, and I was upset and shocked with what just happened. I never recieved a letter from them, even though I was told that they did send a letter that my overdraft privileges were going to be taken away.  I've been with this bank for over 10 years and my family has been banking with them for over 20 years. 
I called them today because I couldn't use my card for medicine. When I called them I was told that the person in charge would have to call me back because they were on the phone. When they called me back I was told that my account was in the negative for 30 days which is impossible because I get paid every two weeks. I was also told that I went over my overdraft last week in which I put in a stop payment which never happened. My account has been in the positive for the last two weeks. I was then told that I can put a request in to get my overdraft privileges back but that is no guarantee, its reviewed. I was disappointed that after 10 years or so of being a checking account holder I was treated like this. I have always pit money back into my checking account, and never has it been an issue until now.

Once upon a time, there was plenty of money to go around.  Banks were giving loans left and right, along with toasters in many cases, and it seems that the only requirement to get a huge mortgage was that you have a pulse.  Even that was waived in some cases.

Unless, you actually had a job and needed to finish building a house.  In that case, no-one would consider lending you the money.  Ours was not a big extravagant house, it was modest, but we needed some more things, like drywall, plumbing fixtures, etc.

After calling just about every bank we could think off, we finally hit upon the bright idea of calling our local bank, and who would have thought?  They gave us the loan, along with decent customer service, convenient hours and several branches.

The loan is now paid and the house is still there.

The free money party, however, is now over.

Moral of the story:  try your local bank first.

Worse customer service stay away, had issue with checking account with overdraft the woman who called me was a low level employee telling me my overdraft protection was suspended the woman was nasty and didn't care of my issue, as you know there is a covid 19 issue going on and the norm is out of wack but there don't care, find a better bank

I wish I could say it's a great local bank. I wish I could say it's better than other options.

But that would all be a lie. There's far better banks and credit unions that are local. There's also a great many more that actually, oh I don't know, offer competent customer service when you call instead of getting shuffled around department to department without a decent resolution. 

Ah well.
This bank is trash. No such thing as overdraft protection and they refuse to give back $37 fees. Don't waste your time here you'll lose more money than you put into the bank

I never knew how much better banking could be by going local. I come in, they know my name and the bank manager, Pete even makes me a coffee once in a while. They've really got their ducks in a row.

It seems like the experience there really matters.

Pete's the best!
Great bank. Everyone is so friendly. You don't have to wait long. They are always happy to help you with what ever your needs
Great bank, haven't had any problem over the years of working with them. Recommend to all.
Deposited a paycheck on a Friday. They put it in as a personal check instead and closed for 4 days with zero way of contacting them. Don't go to this bank if you want a reliable form of banking

The people at this bank are SO rude. Whether it's drive thru or personally walking inside, they look at you as if you're bothering them. When you tell them what you need, it's done slowly and with an attitude. I don't care for the disrespect.
I find this bank very well managed. Staff is always friendly and ready to help. I highly recommend.

Been banking with Union Savings for over 30 years & I love the bank.
But today, at the Brookfield Branch by Costco--experienced the nastiest, most unfriendly tellers ever! I'm a bookkeeper so I bank quite frequently and for multi-million dollar companies. No one was in the bank, so I wanted 2 different tellers to process my deposits from a non-profit so I could get in & out quicker. One had the nerve to say "Well if a customer comes in, I'll have to stop yours (deposit)"
Ok--and what am I??? Not a customer? Lucky for me there are many other branches, because I won't be back there again! Two words--Mean Girls! (They also deposited my paycheck and would not let me see my running bank balance. Oh yeah-to them I'm not a customer.)
Use to think this was a nice small town bank, now that they want to charge me $5 to cash my paycheck I realized it is just another blood sucking bank that doesn't care about people.

so I have been a customer at this bank for twenty years and I needed a student loan payment stopped (which was never supposed to be drafted but that another yelp review). The Dept of Education said so sorry our bad but because it is drafted and due to come out tomorrow there is nothing we can do to stop it. They recommended I call my bank and have them stop the draft payment. I did and was told that JCSB would charge me $30.00 to "attempt" to stop the payment but if it came in tonight hey they would be unable to stop it but they would till keep my $30. I am in tears right now because my mortgage payment is going to bounce because of this. So my choice is take the hit and let them pull the $265 or pay 30 and maybe end up paying 295.00 The girl on the phone tried to help but apparently the bank manager at this branch refused to waive the fee. Thanks for making my life worse during the Covid19 pandemic. I wont forget how you treat your long time customers and when this is over. not only will I switch banks but I am going to tell every single person I know and plenty of strangers that this bank does not care about its customers during the worst crisis this country has seen in 100 years.

I have been banking with Liberty Bank for years. Why? because while every other bank changes names Liberty Bank remains the same. Service with a smile and the small town friendly folks there make banking a pleasure.

They have added more branches to serve us better, but I enjoy the ease of their on-line baking. Bill reminders and easy set-up make this work for us.

There are so many other services I haven't mentioned, like no fee ATM's where you get your fee bank when using another banks ATM. Overdraft protection for my linked savings account too.

What a wonderful bank...
The personal attention, kindness and courtesy extended by all of the staff at this bank is truly above and beyond.
After several decades of business banking - and at several banks - the First Bank of Greenwich has, again and again, gone out of their way to help in all ways big and small, that I've not seen elsewhere.
In an era where decent customer service is constantly diminishing, this bank brings a refreshing and helpful level of focus and attention that's unfortunately hard to find elsewhere. And as a small business, with little to offer in terms of fat bank accounts, I still seem to get attention and service at the 10/10 level.

Best and only true community bank in the area.  Walk in and everyone knows you. kinda like walking into Cheers!  Great people.  Would not go elsewhere for mortgages, business loans, CD's, family or business account.

Applied for the Deposit operations opening with this bank, The bank claims to care about communication but some red flags defiantly came up. Was ghosted after the interview (having been given the deposit operations managers card with her email. just to be ignored and never get an email reply. at this point i had already written this bank off as a place i wouldn't like to join. they called 2 weeks later saying the job had been filled. managers and supervisor over deposit operations need to work on their communication. my advice? avoid this bank.

The tellers are fabulous to work with.  However, when I went in there as a long time customer, to be insulted by the upper management by them questioning provided documentation to deposit a long awaited check,  they have lost my business.  We used Dime Bank because of their commitment to local business, but learned today that they are only committed to themselves.   We will now seek out a local bank willing to be a partner with us to grow our business.  Not a bank who isn't interested in maintaining a 20yr banking relationship.
Great customer service.  Friendly tellers.  Fantastic branch to visit - highly recommend.

The worst bank I have ever dealt with. I got mortgage from them. First year, they didn`t send me the 1098 form. Second year, even though I`m on auto pay and I pay my mortgage and escrow on time all the time, they failed to pay my real estate tax. I found out after I received a late payment letter from the city with penalty and interest. I left massages to the bank escrow department but nobody called back until I called the original mortgage person Jennifer whom I dealt with at first. She took action and I got an email from the escrow department that they had a system error and they are paying the tax now: after 2.5 months it was due and after the city said that they will put a lien on my property if I don`t pay withing 3 days. The worst bank ever!!! If you want to avoid stress, DO NOT EVER get mortgage from them! I would give negative 10 stars if I could.

This is for the rubber ave location in Naugatuck. Terrible service. Came in on Saturday the 15th around 10am just to get a replacement card and I've been sitting here for an hour and a half now looking at people sitting behind the glass doing nothing. When a cashier went over and said something to the people who do the cards he was told they are busy yet I'm looking at them do nothing. Unbelievable. Time for a new bank.

New Bill Pay a disaster !!  Lost history, have to change accounts back to the original manually.
  Now have to enable POP UP windows !  Called to ask why? no one knows,  will get back to me : 5 days still waiting, called again still dont know.    They have a new system and THEY do not know how it works !!!!
  Small time bank wanting to play with the big boys,  they lost!
  Will be going to a new bank

Absolutely the worst bank since the switch. Worst customer service, and to cash a check they required my SS number which is technically illegal and irrelevant. My family has had Naugatuck Savings for over 30 years with multiple mortages through the bank. Needless to say they are switching to a different bank since they sold out. While inside the branch, there were around 6 or 7 people waiting for service, 5 of which were having account issues. I can't imagine they will last very long operating like this. Save yourself the trouble, go somewhere else.
The Summer St branch staff is always helpful knowledgable of my banking needs.Everyone has a smile when I visit the the branch.Keep up the great work

Went there for a simple  deposit.  Was treated with rudeness and impatience by one of the managers.  
I would not trust these folks with mortgage or small business loans iffbthey treat me so poorly over a simple checking account.   Go to another bank

The worst bank I have ever dealt with. I got mortgage from them. First year, they didn`t send me the 1098 form. Second year, even though I`m on auto pay and I pay my mortgage and escrow on time all the time, they failed to pay my real estate tax. I found out after I received a late payment letter from the city with penalty and interest. I left massages to the bank escrow department but nobody called back until I called the original mortgage person Jennifer whom I dealt with at first. She took action and I got an email from the escrow department that they had a system error and they are paying the tax now: after 2.5 months it was due and after the city said that they will put a lien on my property if I don`t pay withing 3 days. The worst bank ever!!! If you want to avoid stress, DO NOT EVER get mortgage from them! I would give negative 10 stars if I could.

I'm always on the go and they drive up window is usually pretty quick. If it's slow it's usually because the people in front are ill prepared. You seldom receive a frown from the bank tellers and they have coffee for you to drink while you wait. I use first county bank for my small business account and have no complaints.

I've was a long time customer of First County Bank and must say I was happy with their customer service, as well as personnel at any branch I've banked at.  I would give that aspect of my experience 5 stars. However, the problem with First County now is they seem to be nickeling and diming their customers to death. They're tacking fees onto everything and when I voiced my concern to the manager - his response was basically, this is the way it is.  Direct deposit at other banks entitle you to a free checking account.  This is not the case with FC as now, there's a $6 fee, plus a minimum balance must be maintained.  I've shopped around and after many years with First County, I've jumped ship to a not so "fee happy" bank.  I've found a bank with a totally free checking account, no minimum balance required...and after 2 direct deposits in 60 days received a $100 gift deposit from the bank!  Do your research - there are better banks out there!
excellent staff and branch services. Unfortunately, they have a completely unusable online banking app, worst ever. Find another bank.
Nothing like getting racist profile cause your cash a check for 2k to actually think I was going to open an account here

Personally I prefer small chain banks as opposed to conglomerates. I like the one-on-one, community atmosphere that they offer; and I don't feel overwhelmed by "the man". There is no agenda. They are not trying to sell you anything. Every time I enter conglomerates (my mother uses one), I feel as though I am being swooped down upon + thrown a hard ball in the face. Not for me!!

This bank has had very low turn around in the tellers. Other banks I've noticed they tend to go through tellers like yesterday's stale leftovers. I know most everyone there by face and am typically greeted upon entering.

I like!
They helped me set up a last minute business account. The location is convenient and I hardly ever wait to make a deposit. The staff are super nice.

USB's business online banking product continues to have issues.  Latest find a payee's address that contains a c/o line is not printing on check.  Phone call for help took 37 minutes and still waiting on resolution to problem!

My husband and I had a great experience working with Darcy to open up a new personal checking account. She was very thorough and answered all of our questions. She took time to sit with us and explained everything. I later visited a couple days later to open a business checking account. 

I can't express how great the personal one-on-one service  was - and it is so important. We never had this great of an experience with Chase or Citibank. We're so happy we're banking with Union Savings Bank now. Thanks, Darcy!
Don't put your money in this bank because any fraudster will be allowed in your account and they won't do a thing about it except charge you a fee. They make you pay for their mistakes trust me!!!!!

Wow and shocking review about service at NWC.  We have been with NWC for more than 40 years and have never seen such behavior with any of the branches. NWC is a great community bank they serve the community with all banking service and more.  They even look at your accounts daily, and will call you if there is unusual activity!  They are friendly, and are part of the community. They do many charitable events for the community. They are there for your major financial events in life, and daily needs. I would go on a vacation with any one of them!  Thank You Northwest Community Bank!  Tom and Nancy, Barkhamsted

I have a pretty good amount in my checking and savings account, so I wanted to put it towards my retirement and invest it , seeing its not makeing me a dime where it is,I call the girl who I originally opened my other two accounts there,and after waiting like ten minuites ,she answers and I tell her who I am and I want to open an IRA ,she says let me get you someone who can help you with that( and just totally blows me rite off, like its not her job.),I get switched back to front desk who did not have clue,I think this is very rude and ignorant knowing  that I oopened two previos accounts there,As a buisness man I,m pissed and takeing my funds out of this ignorant bank and going somewhere that treats me like a costomer.I wanted to stay with a local bank ,but I guess sometimes its just not worth it.

Used to work for a credit union and always felt banks were cold & impersonal. I opened an account with Milford Bank years ago and have been happy with them ever since. They have a wide variety of locations, great hours, friendly staff, online banking and now mobile banking. I am very happy with their service and feel like they actually appreciate their customers!!!

The Torrington Savings Bank office in Goshen is a nice location; they have a fair amount of parking, picnic table in the back, and a drive up ATM and teller. When it was originally being built, I found the TV ads showing the plowed up landscape under the voice-over touting their rock solid foundation in Litchfield County ironically hilarious. Now, the interior is a pretty marble so they have that solid footing, I suppose. The tellers and employees have always been very nice. The only constant negative: there is a speed bump/drainage line from Heck between the bank and the parking lot for the post office/liquor store. Seriously, whoever approved it must have a financial interest in a local autobody shop. Save your front end, and if you need to go from parking lot to the other, just go back on the road and turn that way.

out of all the banks i have this has to be the worst bank ever and the regional manager has an attitude problem they close your account without no notice block your online account whenever they feel like it and it's just horrible do not recommend banking with them
owner_reply: Hi, Nydia, customer feedback helps us understand experiences and needs of our community, with this said, we really need to better understand your situation.  May you please call Lori Dufficy, EVP and Chief Experience & Engagement Officer at 860-448-4184, she is aware of your feedback and looks forward to speaking with you.

review_text:
The staff is always so kind no matter a phone call or entering the branch. 

I barely ever have issues except for an on going issue where our biz account has a note giving a specific request for each deposit but they never do it. I have to call every couple of months for them to go back & do it. They apologize, say they always have new ppl so that's why it doesn't get done. I've kinda just accepted it. It's not the worse thing to happen all though it is a pain to deal with. 

All in all my experience has been great over the years.

I personally don't like this bank (not the branch) They will take OD fees from your account even when they are at fault. They will let ATM fraud occur on your account and never think its suspicious that two payments come out at the same time not even a minute apart. Meanwhile I can log into online banking from the same device every time, get locked out and that's suspicious to them...really, is the fraud even a little suspicious? Then make you wait for days to figure it out. Meanwhile you're on vacation missing hundreds of dollars and they won't just replace it and deal with the merchant at the same time.

Chase will put your money back so as not to inconveince you. And they will get their money from the merchant or theiving ATM whomever took it fraudulently. They don't have their customers deal with it. Do not put your money in this bank you are better off giving it away!!!
Use to think this was a nice small town bank, now that they want to charge me $5 to cash my paycheck I realized it is just another blood sucking bank that doesn't care about people.

i switched to this bank from the other local one i had previously been doing my banking at. i decided to switch as it was closer to my home big mistake!!!  after my phone experience with them not once ....twice....but after  the "third time"  i was totally disgusted with the way they have their customer phone system set up!! when you call it goes directly to the main office with "no option " to speak directly to a certain branch!! ( ridiculous!) the recording automatically puts you in a " so called "q" then proceeding to tell you what call you are & your wait time!!!  well .... the 1st time i was caller #2 w wait time of 8 minutes (again ridiculous) 2nd time i was caller #6 w wait time of 14 minutes... 3rd & last time i was caller # 9 w wait time of 25 minutes!!! i felt as though i was calling a radio station to win concert tickets ... but w this bank you dont win anything!!! it was urgent that i speak w an employee as my debit card was stolen & it was being used racking up astronomical chargers in the meantime!!! dime bank is the worst bank ive ever dealt with.....never again!! after all the problems i had entailed with this "unprofessional " business i was done with them!!! so unacceptable & very unprofessional!!!
this is my local bank. I go there because, everyone that works there is very friendly, and they have been extremely helpful correcting problems  I have had in past banking situations

Liberty Bank contacted ME (again they contacted ME) that there might be some fraudulent charges on our debit card. We checked and there were totaling about $160. One was for a raffle for cookware another from a gym membership and another for a VPN account. The next day we went to the bank and cancelled the card and got a replacement. They bank could not do anything with the transactions at the time because they were "Pending" We left the next day for vacation and returned a week later and went to the bank to fill out the fraudulent claim paperwork. Approximately 10 days later we received letters saying they were valid transactions. We then called Liberty and they said they would send us the docs involved in them calling valid transactions. Never got them. Called again and basically told them "why would come to bank the next day, cancel my card, get a new one, then the same day we get back from vacation go to the bank to fill out paperwork. For my health? So Liberty Bank is relying on some fraudulent data they got instead of an life long customer. Unfortunately Liberty is the only bank in my town and if there was one called Joe's Bank or Not safe Bank I would pull my accounts in a minute. All the good this bank fid for me over the past 50 years went away when they believe some fraudulent person and not a life long customer. Stay Away if you want to keep your money safe.

My relationship with TD bank needed to end after 18 months, and countless fees, penalties, and frustrations.

As was true of TD back then, I will remain cautiously optimistic about Liberty for now. But for the past month, they've been pretty spankin' fantastic. That BreakFree checking account they've got has pretty much everything you could ask for:

-No minimum balance
-$100 bonus if you attach a direct deposit
-Refund of other banks' ATM fees at the end of the billing cycle
-A solid online banking system with bill pay and phone app
-One free bank check per month
-Free MasterCard debit
-A really good ATM with envelope-free deposits

We even got a hand-written card from our banker just yesterday. Yeah, it's a bit of a marketing gimmick, but nevertheless proof that they aren't one of those banks that's too big to fail, or too big to treat people like people.

A newer branch that opened in the past year. This bank has been taking care of my family for years, and I continue to use their services. The tellers are always friendly and know their customers by name. 
Convenient  hours are such a huge plus for a bank, open Saturdays until 3, and open later into the evenings as well. 
Another thumbs up for the drive-through teller, and ATM!!!

Despite what *could* be the most convenient bank I ever had, over the last six years I've shared a neighborhood with this bank, we've had a bit of a rocky start.

The first two times I visited the bank, I needed something notarized. I was told to take a seat and I would be helped. Despite no additional customers entering the bank between the time I entered and the entire time I waited, I was left sitting for over 20 minutes. Feeling abandoned and forgotten both times, I went to the UPS store across the street. I now don't bother considering Thomaston Savings Bank for my notary needs. Most recently, I came in, wearing my work uniform, with one dollar and asked for 2 rolls of pennies. Nothing crazy, just 2 rolls. Why did I ask for these rolls? Because the manager at my workplace was on vacation and left us without pennies by mistake. Since Thomaston Savings Bank is very close to my workplace, and because it's even closer to home, I figured I'd stop by on my way to work. I didn't even get to explain the importance of my work emergency (and how my work's bank is the next town over and how I have no vehicle or way to get there), because I was sternly informed that was a service for their customers only. It was disheartening, considering how they *seem* like a community bank, and how a request for 2 rolls of pennies in an extenuating circumstance is an extremely low risk transaction, with an opportunity to gain both a new customer, and let the person know that Thomaston Savings Bank is a helpful member of the community. 

These three experiences caused me to no longer consider starting a relationship with this bank, despite how temptingly close it is to my home, despite how fancy the atm machine is, nor how bright and welcoming the facility seems. It's kinda a shame, but I don't like feeling ignored and turned away by my community bank.

In the end, another bank in the area happily exchanged my dollar for 2 rolls of pennies. So it's not like a bank *couldn't* do it for a non-customer, it's just Thomaston Savings Bank *won't* do it for a non-customer.

Bar none the worst you could pissibly imagine. Bare customer service. Was very nice years ago but a steady donward spiral  of unknowledgeable and unhelpful staff. Their  entire system needs a complete overhaul, or raze it.
No such thing as overdraft protection here. They take fees out for everything!! Don't waste your time here you'll lose more money then you put in!

Absolutely archaic technology solutions from resetting your online banking password to random debit card blocking without notice at the branch level. Their locations are inconvenient, impossible to manage an issue after hours, my list goes on. Steer CLEAR!
I went to this bank yesterday and all the tellers, Nilsa, Ana, and Jana were friendly!

went to this BANK TO break a $100 bill.
after buzzing me in, they told me that only broke a large bill for a customer.
they said that it was their policy.
how to these jokers expect to get me as a new customer with a policy like that!
well...
never!
pass this bank, AS every other bank will help!
Use to think this was a nice small town bank, now that they want to charge me $5 to cash my paycheck I realized it is just another blood sucking bank that doesn't care about people.

Not specifically this branch, but as a bank, Liberty has shown they do not care about their customers. They acknowledged my account had fraudulent charges but continue to tell me there is nothing they can do! Worst bank, do not trust them with your money!!!

I have been a customer of Union saving since the bank moved into town  The  people that worked there were great but now the  new management leaves a lot to be desired .  I needed a certain seal for some papers, I was told it would cost me $ 20.00 and I had to show probate papers and death certificate which really had me wondering why. I went to People's United where I have another account and they did what I needed with just a ID and no charge .  Union savings bank is not what it use to be. I will be looking into changing banks
Use to think this was a nice small town bank, now that they want to charge me $5 to cash my paycheck I realized it is just another blood sucking bank that doesn't care about people.
The staff is very friendly and helpful, kept very clean been using this bank for over 30 years.
Ok for construction loan. Process a little confusing and not explained too well.
This branch is fantastic!  Customer service goes above and beyond.  Ask for Jen if you need special help with any accounts.  She's a gem.

Liberty bank was fine until they outsourced their online banking in Dec-Jan.  Since then all my payment dates have been moved, they have lost 4 payments so far and insist on charging for stop check fees.  Some payees that got paid in 3 days are not seeing checks for 3 weeks.
What a horrible experience!  I have spent countless hours trying to make sure my bills are not paid late.  This use to be a descent bank, now it is useless.

I have opened a personal and business account in the last several months. The service has been outstanding. No fees. I gave them 4 stars because the ATM is clunky slow and old. Other than that I love the website it does more then my previous bank and checks clear very quickly.

Great bank! They treat you like family there. One of the managers, Collette, is amazing! Very courteous, quick to help with any needs of mine. All the tellers are very friendly and professional. I especially like Jessica and Cidalia. My dog Charlie always looks forward to seeing them and never leaves without some treats! I come a distance from home to bank here. This bank is just to good to go anywhere else!

My husband recently opened a bank account here because he was no longer happy with the services of his current bank.  The tellers here are friendly and professional at all times. 

Tannith is the assistant manager I believe and the woman in charge of opening accounts. She's wonderful and treated us like family. She's a huge reason as to why I switched banks after my husband did.  It's totally free banking which is awesome because I don't think I should pay an account to keep my money safe when fraudulent charges has happened a few times in the past.

Hats off to you Ion Bank.

Advise don't put your HSA account(s) with this bank use BOA if you're a small business owner. Last year on April 14 I wired $5000 into my wife's HSA account at ION. The wire transfer clearly stated it was a 2014 prior year deposit. Little did I know, until yesterday, ION doesn't "read wire transfers" and only deposits them for current year. As a result I can now only add $1750 to her account due to IRS limits. And ION refused to correct the issue and send the IRS an amended docs. Fortunately, I kept proof of the wire memo in BOAs system to show IRS if needed down the road. When I called BOAs HSA dept they were stunned. BOA customer service rep, who has worked for BOA, for 7 years, they said they make HSA corrections all the time and file amended forms to IRS and customer within 3 days. I informed my NML health insurance provider since he recommended the no service bank.
Professional, courteous and helpful service at this local chain of banks.  I get free checking and additional services here!
Five stars For Caesar. In from out of town and was the sweetest customer service rep I've dealt with in CT so far! He even went out of his way to get me water! Bless nice people. Thank you, Caesar!

The worst bank I have ever dealt with. I got mortgage from them. First year, they didn`t send me the 1098 form. Second year, even though I`m on auto pay and I pay my mortgage and escrow on time all the time, they failed to pay my real estate tax. I found out after I received a late payment letter from the city with penalty and interest. I left massages to the bank escrow department but nobody called back until I called the original mortgage person Jennifer whom I dealt with at first. She took action and I got an email from the escrow department that they had a system error and they are paying the tax now: after 2.5 months it was due and after the city said that they will put a lien on my property if I don`t pay withing 3 days. The worst bank ever!!! If you want to avoid stress, DO NOT EVER get mortgage from them! I would give negative 10 stars if I could.

Not the bank that is always there for you.  Trying to refine by loans to pull money to pay off debt and was declined by Milford Bank due to late payments - while other lenders have understood that me paying off my debts would free up money - Milford Bank doesn't understand that.

Will be pulling all of our accounts from this bank due to their lack of understanding and compassion.

Absolutely the worst!  We tried to give the local bank a chance.  Forget it!  Unless you are doing deposits or withdrawals, this bank is incapable of handling any other sort of transaction in a timely matter.  Drove to the Boston Post Road location on July 2nd.  There was a sign on the door that said their lobby was closed and that their downtown office was open.  Drove to the downtown office.  Walked to the counter and told the woman that I wanted to close out my son's account.  She told me that a woman at the desk will help you and that you can take a seat.  There was one man in the seat who tried to come in at noon, but was unable to get service because that ONE person who could help him was at lunch.  Poor Bastard!  So he was waiting in one chair which left the other chair open for the both of us.  We waited from 2:00-2:45.  Nobody said, "thank you for waiting" or "sorry we are understaffed."  One woman was counting money,  another woman was working the counters.  The person working the desk was with a customer, a fourth woman punched out and said goodbye to everyone as customers sat there.  Although no acceptable acknowledgment of their neglect was issued, I did hear the woman counting the money ask why people were waiting, although I couldn't hear the whole response, I did hear "we can only do, what we can do?"  Meaning, how dare us even attempt to do business on a Friday before the holiday.  This is why we are closing out our account.  My son is going off to college and at the ripe age of 18 he has recognized that this bank lacks any ability to provide customer service.  We walked out at 3:00. No service provided.

We have been using Milford Bank for over 20 years.  We've always been treated warmly and professionally.  They have been responsive to our financial needs and I feel I know almost every employee since they have so many local branch's which I utilize on my travels.   My daughter opened her account here and she loves it compared to the commercial banks she has used.  Keep up the great work Milford Bank!

My husband and I refinanced last summer and went through The Milford Bank.  The mortgage department was fantastic!  The staff was patient, professional and helpful.  I would recommend this bank to anyone.

Not community minded.  Tried to refinance a mortgage through them.  Did not even look at my information before telling me that don't think it would be possible.
Very unfriendly as well.  When I initially called, the woman who answered said very abruptly "your calling the wrong person".

I have banked with this community institution for several years, and I was generally happy with their services and customer care. In late December, I needed to close my all of my accounts. These transactions were processed and I was told my accounts were closed. About two months later, I received a notice of a negative balance in an account that should have been closed. After investigating the matter, I found that the account was still open and the bank was requiring payment to close the account. This is terrible customer service. It was through an employee's negligence that my account remained open, and I was charged a monthly service fee. Why should I be held responsible for incompetence? Never bank with these people, save yourself the agony!
Great local bank. They're always there for you when you need them. Way more personal than big banks.

I really hate this bank.  It's almost like they bend over backwards to charge an overdraft fee.  The latest indignity was when I had my "available balance" go into the negative after and BECAUSE I made a deposit, apparently because I transferred some of the money into savings.  The teller informed me I was not in danger of an overdraft, but when a $3 check was presented that day, they cashed it and charged me $29.  The next day another small check was cashed, another $29.  The online banking system is about 24 hours behind "real time" transactions, so even though I check the stupid thing three times a day and think I have money, I get surprised the next day when it's too late to do anything about it.  It probably doesn't help that my previous bank, in another state, was very customer-oriented;  they did whatever they could to make sure incidents like this didn't happen.  I hate this bank.  Run away and put your money in your mattress;  it'll be safer there.

very poor service and lack of communication. This bank also seems to be stuck in the 1990s. Forcing people to come in person (which for someone with 2 babies is not the easiest) when other banks are changing to cater their clients needs Ion continues to drop the ball. In person is a long and slow experience with people unable to properly do their job which speaks volumes on a complete lack of training. The mortgage department also fails to listen to their clients needs and choose their own dates for when payments are processed. I strongly suggest choosing other mortgage brokers before Ion Bank.
Great bank! It's nice to have a banking option with a definite small feel to it and have the 'big bank' features for customers. Ion Bank has been able to do this for me for 15 years!

Had this bank for 51 years never any trouble 
always happy to help whenever needed.

I have been banking here for quite a while. The branch employees are always friendly and helpful. I also see many of them involved in quite a few community events. They aren't hard-sell like the other banks trying to make you get their products whether you want to or not. When I have come in here for information about opening an account or other pertinent issues, they have always found the best fit or solution for me.

I don't bank here - Bestie does. However, I'm in here a lot, notjust with her, because they give a lot of support to the community. I'm often dropping off posters, collecting ad fees, and personally thanking employees for volunteering at different community events. I may just open an account.

Best local bank in the area! I'm on a first name basis with the manager and assistant manager. They are always helpful, and very customer focused.
Low fees, and great service, why use a large national that doesn't care about you.

Tout themselves as a "hometown" bank.  Reality is:  fees, customer service, general policy, like the worst of the Big Banks.  I have moved my mortgage, checking accounts away following 3 thankless years.  

Please check around, you will find many unhappy former clients of Newtown Savings Bank.

Never ever stopping by this bank, i went to cash out my check and how i receive 100 dollar's short from my payment i was so mad  they keept on that it was not their fault that the girl had gave me the exact amount im like really, she must not know how to count because i was missing $100.00.... and after 30 to 40 min later they realize they were over 100 dollars smh, i was this close to call the cops

Horrible customer service. Had to close my account and move my funds to another bank. When I brought an issue which had cost me a lot of time and money , I was told by their branch manager Sara that their employees training issue is now my problem , as I am out the time and money.
great bank been a member of this bank over 28 years nice and friendly always there to help with anything they can at anytime.

Lines were long and our teller was trying to sell every product under the sun. Woman was very friendly and helpful though. Rates are same as any other bank. Parking was okay, but getting in and out of the lot is just as hard as everything else connected to route 5. Not a bad location if you live in the area.

Slow service but the people there are very nice.  I find it impossible to call the local branch since all phone numbers I have put me into a corporate answering machine.  I do business in the Wallingford branch and would like to be able to speak directly to someone in the bank.  Also the hours of the bank and drive up are not listed.

Pretty awsome bank. They people working there are so nice and always willing to help or try. I messed up with a bank account when i was younger, and they still let me open up an account- Checking and savings.
I did not have a good experience with this bank to obtain a new loan.  Their bank guidelines are extremely stringent.  There are better banks and lenders out there.
Non-competitive savings rates, to the point that they take advantage of people.  Won't use this bank again.
Best bank around by far. Very helpful. staff are top knotch

A high quality, full service savings bank with VERY helpful employees.
Emma Cardoso, the manager of the Danbury Main St original location is always very accommodating and always very pleasant and helpful for all our banking needs.
This is the bank of choice for us!

If you have a passbook at this bank, beware. They have just finished an electronics  "upgrade" and your interest will not be printed correctly in it. I tried to bring it to their attention and was basically blown off. The Newtown branch totally treated this as a non issue. Their customer service dept. referred me back to the local branch, said they'd call me back twice, never did. Their treatment of me as a customer leaves much, much to be desired. Ignoring the problem won't make it go away SBD!

I tried to get in to see my account it was two in the morning I needed to transfer funds this happens a lot unfortunately their second safety measure doesn't work if it sends you a code you don't know it because you can't see it or hear it come through if you want it to ring your phone it doesn't and there's no way to get it to do that after three tries it will block you out for the entire weekend and it has no 24 hour service where a human being can fix it for you you're just out of luck so if you're out of the country or out of the state and you don't even know what your balances it's like not having an account at all

When my mother's bank left the Torrington area I wanted her to use a more 'national' brand since we lived in different states and it would be easier for me to help her if she used a national brand. 

Her friends encouraged her to use Torrington Savings Bank (TSB) instead. While I wasn't happy with the decision at the time, I am thrilled now. The service is unparalleled. I wish they were a national/global brand so I could use them. Every interaction feels so personal. Staff are committed to helping and know how to do what you need in a single call.

If there were more stars I'd be giving them more stars. They really are amazing.
Just opened a account at the main street branch. Very nice and helpful and wow free checks.
I just refinanced with Torrington Savings Bank. Very pleasant people to work with, and they have some great rates available. What else can I say?

They are very detail oriented The customer service woman have always been great! The Tellers depends on who you get. When Target had the breach they already ha a new card out I me before I knew there was a problem I was very thankful for that. Banks are always clean good hours and good parking at the one across from Wendy's

Other lenders tend to recommend TSB if you have any kind if minor credit issues and you need a loan, they say because a local bank usually has more leverage.  I get it is not TSB's fault that other lenders say this but TSB dose claim to have excellent customer service , excessive knowledge of loans,  and can offer real hometown banking.  This may be true if you earn 50-100 thousand dollars are year and bank with them, or you have stellar credit.  If you do not fall into any of these categories forget it , not only will you be denied without any opportunity to speak with someone ( if you apply online ) , you also will not hear ANYTHING from anyone in regards to your loan status. You can call , email and you will just get the run around, and in the end just get a letter in the mail saying your denied.  The letter they sent me said my credit was just barley 500, but I have reports directly from all 3 credit bureau's and they all matched at 660.  I tried to get a opportunity to show them this and question why they where 160 points less but was never given the opportunity , they just didn't want to hear it.    I went with another local lender and was very pleased with there professionalism , courtesy and communication even though they could not help me now, they are helping me get where I need to be so they can offer me a excellent loan and rate in another 6 months.  So if you have challenged credit move on to someone else don't waist your time.

Never thought I would review a bank but I saw them listed here and decided it was appropriate.  I have done business with them for years.  They have been around for like 100 years and will be around for a lot longer.  A true hometown bank.  They're from the area and they understand it.  They hold onto all of the mortgages they write, and I'll bet they have written very, very few bad loans over the years.  Makes me feel even more angry about taxpayer bailouts of so many other greedy know-nothing banks who were out to give no income verification loans to any idiot they could sell one to, because the banks never intended to hold onto the loans in the first place, but rather sell them to be camouflaged into derivatives to be sold to other, unsuspecting fools.  Well, off my soapbox.  I don't expect TSB to ever be swallowed up by a megabank, and as long as they remain the same hometown bank, they've got my business.

If you are looking for traditional ,community oriented ,helpful friendly communicating banking do NOT bank here.My parents selected this bank to mortgage our home .After making months of timely payments my parents were hit by an unexpected changes and quickly fell behind in our home mrtg payments.My parents have asked GSb to work with them  to keep their home and  to resume mrtg payments.My parents managed to obtain  little more than 90% of the mortgage arrearage .This bank chooses to put us out of our house instead of forgiving the less than 10% or some of the fees or working with them on the little less than 10% shy of the arrearage  to keep our home.The GSB will gladly take your business your money AND YOUR HOME.My parents have yet been offered any workable solution .

I have been a customer here for over a decade, since I was a teenager. A few months ago, I needed a stop payment on a check, which they refused to do with out a $30 charge. I told them I was going to wait until I moved and changed jobs (as I was in the middle of a cross country move), and close my account, which they refused. Now I just called to cancel and they offered to do the stop payment for free. I refused and wanted to close the account, which they won't do over the phone and a requiring a notarized letter. I told them I would just let the account sit empty then. They said eventually it would go dormant and close. Their customer service has gone so far downhill, it's disgusting.

Really? The day after Christmas, they decided to close? Ignoring the needs of customers that might need to use the bank the day after and closing a financial institution whose hours may be governed by FEDERAL rules? Someone needs to investigate WHY they completely closed all weekend!

Stay away from this bank. They send you a new card in about two weeks, slowest cheapest way possible and the security is not trustworthy. They will cut your card off if you try to ping the card at all. Making it impossible to use the card for a week.
Use to think this was a nice small town bank, now that they want to charge me $5 to cash my paycheck I realized it is just another blood sucking bank that doesn't care about people.

I really don't like that I couldn't send flowers and a gift basket to Canada for my aunt's funeral on time, without them blocking the card.  Did you know you cannot use the Union Savings Debit Card for any transactions overseas including Canada? It's actually better and cheaper and safer to stop banking there altogether and get a PayPal account which has less fees and is more progressive. They eventually unblocked the card for me for 24 hours. So wait, I can use my own money? That's just unreal. Dear Union Savings Bank Corporate, If you're having problems with fraud overseas you need to build a robust security system, not limit the usage of your customers money. And more importantly, not ask customers to come in a branch and sign a release. That makes no sense. What if The customer was actually in Canada? Customers should be notified via  email that their transaction didn't go through, then be linked to their online account where they can go through a list of security questions and be allowed to charge what they want, wherever they want. Limiting the use of ones money is bad banking. I feel bad for the nice people working at the bank locally in Litchfield that have to enforce these bogus policies. Give them a break too. They don't like having to say "no" all the time either.

the best bank- as their logo says,  "big enough to help you, small enough to know you".  I am always greeted by name, and I love the coffee they always have perking.
Whenever I need  some extra help, I go to Sam.  He is the customer service rep, and goes out of his way for the customer.  They are even open till 7:00 pm  on friday!   Your money is safe there :-)

True, your money may be safe there, but only when you can actually access it. After having lived in a large city and then moving to NWCT I was looking forward to slowing down a bit and enjoying a more relaxed, personal environment. But Union Savings is waaaay too laid back.
Yes, they are nice at the branches, for the most part. I was denied notary services from the branch manager because she "didn't feel comfortable" signing the form as she "hadn't seen one of these particular forms before." So? It was a legal form. 
My biggest problem was that if I deposited any kind of check on a Friday, it wasn't available until the following Tuesday. If that Monday happened to be a holiday, funds were available the following Wednesday. Today I attempted to log in to my online banking account and I miss-typed my password three times. My account access was blocked and I was prompted to call customer service. Ok, that's cool, you are simply protecting me from fraud. But when I went to call customer service I was told, via a recording, that they do not hold Sunday hours. What would I do if my debit card was stolen? Wait until after the weekend to call? 
Tomorrow morning I will be closing my account with Union Savings and going back to the big, bad (yet proficient-at-their-jobs!) BOA

Union Bank has no policy or concern for anyone who has any kind of health problem, never mind a life threatening one like I have. There only concern is the bottom line.. I have never been treated with less concern in my 35+ years in business. I have been made offers and then had them rec ended without explanation. Do Not Do business with Union Bank if you might ever get ill, you will not get any help from the people that I have delt with at this bank. I have to think that the management cannot know what is going on with there customers that have legitimate problems and are not trying to stiff the bank out of money.    Please feel free to ad your experience, I can't be the only one that has become ill at know fault of there own.

Rather than go with a large bank like Wells Fargo, I chose this small local bank for my new business to work within my community.  Everything is going great. I just hired my first employee but in terms of this bank  I am not at all pleased.  I needed to make an international swift wire transfer from Europe.  I called the bank at 8:45am; 9:00am; and 9:30am to get information to make the transfer as the Union Savings Bank website posts the Washington Depot bank branch hours starting at 8:30am.   In Europe transfers won't be processed after 3pm.  It is now 9:40am EST and 2:40pm in Europe.  Each time I called the branch I got a recording saying that the bank was closed. This is really unacceptable.  I also called the phone number of the head of business banking and got a recording as well.  People at the branch are of course very nice which is great but all the smiles are useless if a bank can't serve the business needs of its customers. I didn't want to post this as I like the people at the branch.  However,  I am getting ready to close my account and go with the Wells Fargo branch in Woodbury.  Whoever is the head of Union Savings Bank I hope they read these yelp comments and tighten up the bank.
Great tellers in the two banks that I use, Jewett City and Preston.   They know my name and are always ready to help and even make suggestions.   It is the perfect hometown bank!

Be prepared for fees if you're not the best bookkeeper. I made an online credit card payment to my cardholder which was a bit more than the amount in my checking account because I didn't account for my insurance payment being deducted at the same time. My savings account had a more than adequate amount to cover the difference, however, the two were not linked. Ultimately, this led to three separate $27 fees. I don't have extra to spend on their ridiculous fees. Not only have I been a customer for years, I've had direct deposit for all of those years. Never again Jewett City, consider that my one time donation to any cause in your town.
I love this bank only cause they have a coin machine so now I don't need to go to coin star thank god

The tellers are probably the rudest I have ever seen in any bank anywhere with the exception of a few. I keep a low amount in my checking just for the purpose of paying bills. I keep a small amount in my savings which is linked to my checking in case there is an overdraft. I receive an amount every two weeks in order to pay some local bills, credit cards, etc. Sometimes the amount of the check is higher than the amount in the checking and savings put together. Not by much. Each time the teller has to go through the drill of telling me that she/he has to place a hold on the money in my checking until the incoming check clears. Then they go and print something that they read to me, make me sign, and then send me on my way. The last time, a new teller had to check with a senior teller who scrutinized the check and loudly announced "What is this? Alimony?" Very loudly. I hate to tell the rude people at this bank - when I look at my accounts online, the hold happens automatically. Electronically. The warning is above the checking account online. And it comes off after the two day hold is up. The incoming check has never bounced. So what is the point of embarrassing me as a customer, making me wait until they print something (which I immediately shred), and then read it aloud to me as if I were mentally challenged.

Large Union savings Bank, easy to get to.  However, they charge you $5 to cash a check if you do not have an account with them.  While a one time deal is no big deal it does add up when you cash a check with them every week.  

It doesn't pay for us to open an account here because we live in a town without a USB, but my husbands company uses USB for payroll.

So glad to have a NWCB so close! Love this bank, I've been a customer for over 10 years and plan to do so for as long as I'm able. Would recommend to any new customer or young adult who is looking for their first checking or savings account locally.

Liberty Bank contacted ME (again they contacted ME) that there might be some fraudulent charges on our debit card. We checked and there were totaling about $160. One was for a raffle for cookware another from a gym membership and another for a VPN account. The next day we went to the bank and cancelled the card and got a replacement. They bank could not do anything with the transactions at the time because they were "Pending" We left the next day for vacation and returned a week later and went to the bank to fill out the fraudulent claim paperwork. Approximately 10 days later we received letters saying they were valid transactions. We then called Liberty and they said they would send us the docs involved in them calling valid transactions. Never got them. Called again and basically told them "why would come to bank the next day, cancel my card, get a new one, then the same day we get back from vacation go to the bank to fill out paperwork. For my health? So Liberty Bank is relying on some fraudulent data they got instead of an life long customer. Unfortunately Liberty is the only bank in my town and if there was one called Joe's Bank or Not safe Bank I would pull my accounts in a minute. All the good this bank fid for me over the past 50 years went away when they believe some fraudulent person and not a life long customer. Stay Away if you want to keep your money safe.

This is a great bank that offers fantastic benefits with there various accounts available. The Simsbury branch in particular is great! Everyone is always upbeat, very helpful and super nice. Everything that you'd expect from a local bank.

I like this location. It's a small bank, but the people here get the job done. They are quick, reliable and friendly. I never find myself ever in a line or waiting long. The bank is clean, well lit, and the staff are very professional.

The only thing I can say about this bank was that it is a very convenient bank if you are shopping in the area or visiting and you want to get some quick cash. They have a 24 hour ATM which is extremely convenient. There's also handicapped parking right in front of the bank as well as regular parking on the street for a limited time. I believe it said 15 minute parking so that you could use the bank. I love the decorations in the front and because it was Veterans Day the streets were decorated with lots of flags. So nice to see.
owner_reply: Thank you so much for leaving us a review! We are happy to hear about your positive experience with us, and we look forward to seeing you again!

review_text: Very helpful down to earth staff. The only downside to using Chelsea Groton Bank is that they are a smaller scale bank and only have locations available locally. Highly recommend regardless though

Terrible customer service (especially upper management) and an ATM that for months has struggled with deposits but has yet to be serviced or replaced. This is the worst GSB branch by a factor of ten.  Save yourself the trouble and bank with a different GSB location.

I like the people that work there, but I have a problem with there policies, I had a CD for over 3 years, I pulled my money out and they kept all the money made in interest. It was a 3 year cd. When I said something, I was told "we have lawyers " not sure what that meant, I took it as - lawyers sanction all the banks polices, so I guess they are justified in there own minds to take my money. Good customer service would dictate that the bank in good faith could have given me some, most or all of my interest back. They could of taken 3 months interest as a penalty but desired to take 3 years 3 months penalty.

Been a Liberty Bank customer for decades. Also a TD Bank customer. Decided to move some money from TD Bank to Liberty Bank, so I had TD Bank wire over a significant deposit to Liberty. Liberty had the nerve to charge a $10 fee for the incoming deposit. Went to the branch I've used for decades. They said they can't reverse fees, but to call the Liberty line. The first Liberty line representative said she'd get back to me on reversing the fee within a couple of days. Weeks later, she never called back. The representative I spoke with today said that fees are in the updated disclosure documents and he will not reverse it. If Liberty Bank is so eager to charge fees that they are now charging for deposits, I will certainly take my deposits and my banking to TD Bank. Liberty Bank is not what it was years ago. I'd advise you to consider the fees very carefully before you choose to bank with Liberty Bank.

When Liberty went through the transition of their online program, something happened with one of my credit card bills and the payment did not process through. I received an alert, had to update their payment address and then they paid it via check which arrived after the due date. I connected with Kaleigh via the online message center and she addressed things right away for me. I uploaded a copy of the statement showing the late fee over the weekend and on Monday AM she responded and stated that fee had been deposited into my account. 

I appreciate their efforts and support.

Worse Bank IN CT, so disgusted with them and their lies. Go anywhere else!!! I cannot believe they are allowed to operate with the lack of service. They get a "new system", horrible, taking weeks for the online bill pay to pay Comcast, seriously, before 2 days and now I have late fees, seriously DO NOT USE THEM!!!!  Your money would be better under your mattress!!!

Liberty Bank contacted ME (again they contacted ME) that there might be some fraudulent charges on our debit card. We checked and there were totaling about $160. One was for a raffle for cookware another from a gym membership and another for a VPN account. The next day we went to the bank and cancelled the card and got a replacement. They bank could not do anything with the transactions at the time because they were "Pending" We left the next day for vacation and returned a week later and went to the bank to fill out the fraudulent claim paperwork. Approximately 10 days later we received letters saying they were valid transactions. We then called Liberty and they said they would send us the docs involved in them calling valid transactions. Never got them. Called again and basically told them "why would come to bank the next day, cancel my card, get a new one, then the same day we get back from vacation go to the bank to fill out paperwork. For my health? So Liberty Bank is relying on some fraudulent data they got instead of an life long customer. Unfortunately Liberty is the only bank in my town and if there was one called Joe's Bank or Not safe Bank I would pull my accounts in a minute. All the good this bank fid for me over the past 50 years went away when they believe some fraudulent person and not a life long customer. Stay Away if you want to keep your money safe.
Since changing to a "new improved website" their electronic bill pay doesn't work. And no response to email. I chose a local bank hoping for better customer service, but this was not a good choice.

Do not use this Bank. They want to get rich off of fees. I was sick in the Hospital and own and Business which the bank account is with them plus my personal account. They want to charge NsF fees to a debt card which is ridiculous. Go elsewhere for your banking as this bank is a joke!!!!

I've been with this bank for 10 years with no issues other than the occasional overdraft fee due to some charge I may have forgotten about at the time. However, two weeks ago I tried to deposit a check I received from my aunt and three days later my mobile and online banking accounts were locked. I called in and was told they were going to look into it and get back to me in 3 business days. During this time my aunt had taken out the money and given me the money in cash to deposit. I never tried to resubmit the check after that but still couldn't access my account. A week passed with no return call and I received a letter saying they couldn't accept the check and were deducting a $15 fee. I call back and am told to wait again. I receive a call 20 minutes later telling me my account is pending closing because it looks like I tried to deposit a fake check so I can either go to a local branch or wait to receive the official paperwork. I packed up my newborn and went down to the bank where the lady working at the time was very helpful and assisted me in pleading my case, however, despite her trying to fight it for 20 minutes, she informed me that the call had already been made to close my account and that all she could do was destroy my debit card and withdraw all my money. 10 years, since I was 16 with no incidents and this is what I get in return. The craziest part is that my mother also received a check from the same aunt and deposited it the same day only for it to bounce and her to have to deposit the cash she gave her yet no action has been taken against her account. I wouldn't suggest using this bank as they are unpredictable and unreliable even though they may seem beneficial and secure upfront.
Go to this bank if you like high fees and poor customer service. They also don't know how to spell "receivable" on their statements. I have closed my account with them.

Poor customer service ... Call the 800 # and it took 20 minutes on hold?! And this during normal banking hours. 

Saving interest rates are always below other banks. 

No more $ invested in this institution. 

Why would anyone want to have a relationship with this bank?

I changed over from a credit union that I had been with for 25 years to Liberty only because I wanted a change and Liberty offered no fee banking and being on the go all the time, that worked for me. Their customer service has gotten better, but when I go and charge something on credit, it should automatically go into pending and when it doesn't, my checking will go into the negative and then I get the famous $33.00 fee which they love to use whenever they can. I just do not feel that "personal satisfaction" like I did at the credit union. I'll be changing over soon.

The BEST bank in the United States .. they are honest .. they are friendly .. they are local and most importantly they are not scam artists like 95% of banks nowadays .. hardly any fees and they even refund other banks atm fees!!  AND they promised me $100 if i opened a checking account ... with direct deposit and they  really gave it to me .. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Liberty Bank .
Always had great service with this bank.  They have a checking account which refunds ATM fees so you don't need to be worried about the fact that they only have ATMs in their CT area.

A lovely bank! Such nice people working here, the one near the post Rd isn't as friendly from what I've seen, but this one is definitely something I drive out of my way for. The people remember your name and truly make you feel that neighborly vibe!

Was in drive up teller at 3:55 and when I got up at 4:01 because there was 2 people in front of me I was greeted by a snotty teller that insisted I wasn't there because she could see in her mirror.   Then extremely sarcastic when the checks were made out to my children and I signed them.  Obviously a toddler can't sign a check. The attitude and sarcasm was unnecessary.  Happy New Years

New Bill Pay a disaster!   Loses history, have to change accounts manually back to where they were.
  Have to enable POP UP windows !!  Asked why ? no one knows, will get back to me, 5 days still waiting.   Seems they have a brand new feature and they don't even know how it runs
  Small time bank trying to play with the big boys, too bad they lost

  Will be looking for a new bank

As an account holder with Ion bank, I must say I am very pleased with their services and customer service. On the rare occasion that I've had an issue, it has been handled quickly easily and satisfactorily. They make everything so easy. This is the same type of service that I have enjoyed with small banks and credit unions I've used previously. My only regret is that now that I'm moving out of state they do not have branches there. I highly recommend them and would again mention their excellent customer service throughout all branches and service levels!!
bank hours are not on website . Called the bank computer response sucks. Very Very Very Very Very Very hard to do business with Ion banks

Their new bill pay system pays bills before it posts direct deposits and charges customers insufficient funds fees for trust monies that it has already received. Do NOT bank here until they scrap their bill pay system.

I have been a Liberty Bank customer for over 20 years.  The customer service has always been excellent and for personal banking, I like the account options.  We live in Hebron so we have plenty of branches nearby with both Colchester and Marlborough offices being within 15 minutes.  Their online services have kept up with technology improvements, I absolutely loved it when they introduced digital check deposits through the mobile app.   Highly recommended!

I do not use this bank- my boyfriend does. I often go here to deposit money for him and I always use the drive thru. One day i waited 15 minutes and there was only 2 cars in front of me.... slowest service I've ever received. The people who work here are nice, but the service takes forever.
The drive through workers here make me so uncomfortable that I literally have panic attacks about going for any reason. I have only been able to use the ATM for the last few months.
Use to think this was a nice small town bank, now that they want to charge me $5 to cash my paycheck I realized it is just another blood sucking bank that doesn't care about people.
